intro: Serapias parviflora subsp. laxiflora, commonly known as the looseflower sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are basal, hairy, and often lobed, contributing to its distinct appearance. It blooms in spring and is often found in open habitats such as slopes and coastal areas.
